title: 114_s3245
content: The Act is titled the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse leader programs eligible for support. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized Clinical Nurse Specialist Programs that provide full-time education for registered nurses to effectively care for inpatients and outpatients with acute and chronic illness. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized Clinical Nurse Specialist Programs that prepare nurses to provide care for inpatients and outpatients with acute and chronic illness. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses that offers primary care or wellness services to underserved or vulnerable populations. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses that provides primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses that provides primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice amends the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse specialists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs includes amending various sections of the Public Health Service Act to update years from 2007 to 2021 and from 2014 to 2021 for loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loan program, and comprehensive geriatric education. Funding for carrying out parts B, C, and section 831 is also addressed. The Public Health Service Act is being amended to update years from 2007 to 2021 for nursing programs, including loan repayment and scholarship programs. Funding for parts B, C, and section 831 is also being addressed. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and among diverse population groups. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in diverse training settings and among various population groups, including professional nurses, advanced education nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel, including licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides, to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by developing and implementing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development. The Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel through internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development. Amendments include changes to subsection (g) to allow for nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
